That's actually not the best way to do things.  I have posted here several
times a better way of integrating JUnit with VAJ.

-Jason

    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: Mark Meyers [mailto:markm@...]
    > Sent: Wednesday, August 22, 2001 12:12 PM
    > To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
    > Subject: RE: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
    > 
    > 
    > I'm not a specialist in VAJ or it's tools. But this could help:
    > http://www.junit.org/junit/doc/vaj/vaj.htm#fromMenu
    > 
    > Mark
    > 
    > -----Original Message-----
    > From: messy_head_2001@... [mailto:messy_head_2001@...]
    > Sent: woensdag 22 augustus 2001 17:42

    > Subject: [junit] Re: ClassNotFoundException
    > 
    > 
    > Yeah I've definitely put the classpath in the TestRunner 
    > class and 
    > I've added my project to the workspace classpath in VisualAge...
    > 
    > but I think it must be a classpath issue, as if I run 
    > JUnit from the 
    > tools menu in Visual Age it cannot find any of my classes.
